  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27944].
  {panel}

Heartbeat doesn't produce any output when there is an error connecting to the server (application service not available, network connection problem, etc..)

If there is a temporary server failure and the user has a valid authorization cookie (he checked the "remember me" option when logged in), the connection will be restored when the server is back up, and the user won't probably notice it.

If he hasn't, then successive heartbeat requests will keep failing without any warning (401 errors), with the risk of losing data when the user attempts to save the page.

Possible solutions:

- Warn the user when there is problem heartbeating so he knows and takes the appropriate measures.
- Save the current draft in localStorage, so we can recover it in the case of error when posting the page ([~cpetchell]'s idea)
fields.summary: Heartbeat doesn't output error when the connection to the server fails.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27923].
  {panel}

As of our docs here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+For+MySQL

It says that the server level collation also has to be set, however as of the official MySQL docs (http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/charset-server.html) say:
_"The server character set and collation are used as default values if the database character set and collation are not specified in CREATE DATABASE statements. They have no other purpose."_

This came up in one ticket here: [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-10923?focusedCommentId=3264345&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-3264345].

I believe it is just easier to set the default collation for the whole server and not only set it on DB level, which would be sufficient for Confluence too as it is for JIRA.

Obviously this theory needs confirmation, this is why I did not edit the doc straight.
fields.summary: MySQL documentation for server collation/charset

  {panel}

Hello Atlassians,

I'd really like to request an increment macro.  Here is an example in a table:

|increment|Apples|
|increment|Bananas|
|increment|Coconuts|

When the page is parsed, it would be shown as follows:

|1|Apples|
|2|Bananas|
|3|Coconuts|

In addition, you should be able put the increments in groups so you can have several on a page.

|{increment:group=fruit}|Apples|
|{increment:group=fruit}|Bananas|
|{increment:group=fruit}|Coconuts|
|{increment:group=veg}|Aubergines|
|{increment:group=veg}|Beans|
|{increment:group=veg}|Carrots|

Becomes

|1|Apples|
|2|Bananas|
|3|Coconuts|
|1|Aubergines|
|2|Beans|
|3|Carrots|

Also, specifying a unique ID for a counter would mean you can reference an increment instance.

{increment:group=list_of_presents} Teddy bear
{increment:group=list_of_presents:id=my_favourite_present} Optimus Prime
{increment:group=list_of_presents} Box of chocolates

You can now put:

"Please see present #{increment:value_of=my_favourite_present} which was my best ever!"

In addition, you'd be able to attach child-increments into parents and have decimal-based numbers like 1.4, 5.3.21 etc.


Thank you for your time.  Keep up the good work!  d:-)

h3.Problem
[Details Summary Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Details+Summary+Macro] does not render JIRA Issues Macro from within [Metadata Details Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Metadata+Details+Macro].

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Confluence Page
# Create a table like below:
#* !1.png!
# Create any search within JIRA, and produce a valid XML for a JIRA Issues Macro URL
# Insert > Other Macro > JIRA Issues Macro, paste the URL, and thick [x] Count
# Save.
# You'll have something like this: 
#* !2.png!
# Save
# Create a new Page that will hold the [Details Summary Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Details+Summary+Macro]
# Insert > Other Macro > Details Summary Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-27873].
  {panel}

Most Confluence OutOfMemory errors that we see in OnDemand are caused by attachment indexing, specifically PDF indexing and Office Connector (doc, xls, ppt) indexing.

These OOMs are problematic for a number of reasons:
- they are disruptive to the customer because it triggers the instance to be restarted (~5-10 mins downtime),
- they sometimes happen repeatedly in a loop, requiring manual intervention by Support/HOPS, and
- they result in Confluence's Xmx being raised (overall higher memory costs for the Unicorn platform).

I suspect fixing the attachment indexers is a tough problem. Instead, I propose that we simply disable these attachment indexer modules by default in OnDemand.

In my experience, OnDemand customers do not commonly use this functionality. If customers do want it, they can submit a Support request to have us enable it. This would provide good information on how much it's being used and how much an effect turning it off by default would improve overall Unicorn stability and memory usage.
fields.summary: Disable attachment indexing in OnDemand by default
